summary: This is an FBI travel authorization request (EAN) for personnel to travel to West Palm Beach, FL, to interview a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell sex trafficking investigation. It provides a case summary, references the upcoming Maxwell trial, and lists estimated expenses.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the central figure charged with sex trafficking and conspiracy for the sexual exploitation and abuse of minors. His arrest in July 2019 is mentioned.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a co-conspirator who assisted Epstein by recruiting, grooming, and abusing minors. Her arrest in July 2020 and upcoming trial date are noted.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.role: Detective, NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Listed at the end of the document as a contact, presumably associated with the task force involved in the investigation.

connections.description: Maxwell is explicitly described as a co-conspirator who assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged and arrested with sex trafficking and conspiracy.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged and arrested with enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Jury Selection
events.description: Jury selection for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial was scheduled to begin.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Start
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial was set to begin.

events.title: Planned Witness Interview Travel
events.description: FBI personnel planned to travel to West Palm Beach, FL, to interview a witness of sex trafficking.

locations: New York, NY (implied by NYO/C20 field office and SDNY)
keyFacts: The FBI New York, in coordination with the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office, was actively investigating the sexual exploitation of minors by Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators as of October 2021.
Ghislaine Maxwell's trial for charges related to enticing, transporting, and conspiring to traffic minors was scheduled for November 29, 2021.
The document authorizes travel for law enforcement to interview a witness in West Palm Beach, FL, indicating ongoing investigative activity in the case.
The document lists Detective Paul Byrne of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force as a contact.
